How can I create a basket currency using Verus, and what are some of the options I can use to customize its behavior, such as `prelaunchcarveout`, `prelaunchdiscount`, and `weights`?

To create a basket currency using Verus, you can use the `definecurrency` command with specific options. A basket currency is a type of currency that holds reserves of other currencies, and allows users to preconvert their funds into the new currency before it launches.

Here's an example of how to create a simple basket currency called `BusinessBrand`:
```json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"BusinessBrand", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "prelaunchcarveout":0.1
}'
```
In this example, `options`:33 specifies that this is a basket currency. The `currencies` field specifies that the reserves of `BusinessBrand` will be composed of `vrsctest`. The `initialsupply` field sets the initial supply of `BusinessBrand` to 100 units.

The `prelaunchcarveout` field is used to specify a percentage of the reserves that will be taken out of the reserves and given to the rootID (the creator of the currency) when the currency is launched. In this case, 10% of the reserves will be taken out, which will lower the reserve ratio by 10%.

Another option you can use when creating a basket currency is `prelaunchdiscount`. This option allows you to give users a discount during the preconversion time frame. After the currency is launched, the conversion price will be higher, depending on the percentage of the discount. For example:
```json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"DiscountBrand", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "prelaunchdiscount":0.5
}'
```
In this example, users who preconvert their `vrsctest` into `DiscountBrand` will receive a 50% discount. After the currency is launched, the conversion price will be 50% higher, and the reserve ratio will be 50% lower due to the discount.

Finally, you can use the `weights` option to customize the respective weights of the reserves in a basket currency. The total of all weights must equal 1, and each weight must be at least 0.1, since there can't be more than 10 reserve currencies in a basket currency.

These options allow you to customize the behavior of your basket currency and create a unique experience for your users.

Example currency:
``` json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"BusinessBrand", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "prelaunchcarveout":0.1
}'
```
☝️ This is a basket currency called BusinessBrand. People can preconvert VRSCTEST into its reserves in return for 100 BusinessBrand distributed among them. When the currency is launched, 10% VRSCTEST is taken out of the reserves, into the rootID. This lowers the reserve ratio by 10%.### **"prelaunchdiscount"**
Only works with basket currencies (`options:33`). Use this to give people a discount during the preconversion time frame. After the preconversion time frame and the currency is launched, the conversion price will be higher, depending on what percentage the discount was.When using this parameter, after the currency is launched, the reserve ratio will be lowered by the discounted percentage.Example currency:
``` json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"DiscountBrand", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "prelaunchdiscount":0.5
}'
```
☝️ This is a basket currency called DiscountBrand. People can preconvert VRSCTEST into its reserves in return for 100 DiscountBrand distributed among them. Immediately after the launch of the currency, when people want to convert, the price is 50% higher. Also, the reserve ratio is 50% lower because of the prelaunchdiscount.### **"weights"**
Only works with basket currencies (`options:33`). Use this to change the respective weights of the reserves in a basket currency. The total of all weights must equal 1. With a minimum of 0.1, since there can’t be more than 10 reserve currencies in a basket currency.
